# Head to the `biomejs/biome` repository, and modify the source code in there.

title: noUselessUndefined
description: |
  Disallow the use of useless `undefined`.
---
import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

**Diagnostic Category: `lint/nursery/noUselessUndefined`**
<Tabs>
<TabItem label="JavaScript (and super languages)" icon="seti:javascript">
**Since**: `vnext`
:::note
- This rule has a **safe** fix.
:::

:::caution
This rule is part of the [nursery](/linter/rules/#nursery) group.
:::

Sources: 
- Same as: <a href="https://github.com/sindresorhus/eslint-plugin-unicorn/blob/main/docs/rules/no-useless-undefined.md" target="_blank"><code>unicorn/no-useless-undefined</code></a>

Disallow the use of useless `undefined`.

`undefined` is the default value for new variables, parameters, return statements, etc., so specifying it doesn't make any difference.

## Examples

### Invalid

```js
let foo = undefined;
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.js:1:11 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-useless-undefined">lint/nursery/noUselessUndefined</a> <span style="color: #000; </span><span style="color: Orange;"><strong>undefined</strong></span><span style="color: Orange;">.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>let foo = undefined;<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>          <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span <strong>2 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;"><strong>undefined</strong></span><span style="color: lightgreen;"> is the default value for new variables, parameters, return statements, etc… so specifying it doesn't make any difference.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Safe fix</span><span style="color: lightgreen;">: </span><span style="color: lightgreen;">Remove the undefined.</span><br />  <br />  <strong>  1 │ </strong>let<span style="opacity: 0.8;">·</span>foo<span style="opacity: 0.8;">·</span><span style="color: Tomato;">=</span><span style="opacity: 0.8;"><span style="color: Tomato;">·</span></span><span style="color:
```js
const {foo = undefined} = bar;
```

```js
const noop = () => undefined;
```

### Valid

```js
let foo;
const {foo} = bar;
function foo() {
  return;
}
function* foo() {
  yield;
}
function foo(bar) {}
function foo({bar}) {}
foo();
```

- [Configure the rule fix](/linter#configure-the-rule-fix)
- [Rule options](/linter/#rule-options)

</TabItem>
</Tabs>
